definition: weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle
measure of length, ten Chinese feet (3.3 m)/to measure/husband/polite appellation for an older male
to fight a battle/to go to war
to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
honor guard/guard of honor/the banner bearing contingent leading a military procession
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
to work hard towards a turnaround/to fight to reverse sth
antithesis (two lines of poetry matching in sense and sound)/to fight/to wage war
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around

sentences.english: But his most important victory was against testicular cancer.
sentences.chinese: 但是他打得最漂亮的一场仗是战胜了睾丸癌。

sentences.english: Thanks to unknown military merits young Kim was just promoted to four-star general.
sentences.chinese: 仗着无人知晓的军功，小金刚刚被晋升为四星上将。

sentences.english: This was the epoch when a National Guardsman fought like a Zouave.
sentences.chinese: 在那个时代国民自卫军打起仗来就象轻步兵一样。

sentences.english: It is easier to fight a downhill battle than attempting to influence change from the bottom up.
sentences.chinese: 打一个下坡仗要比试图自底向上影响变更要更容易。

sentences.english: They clashed against each other on the great plains of the American Midwest.
sentences.chinese: 他们在美国中西部的大平原上互相打起仗来。

sentences.english: Boudicca fought her last battle at an unknown site.
sentences.chinese: 布狄卡在一个现在无法确定的地点打了最后一场仗。

sentences.english: The country warred with its neighbors for years.
sentences.chinese: 该国与邻国打了多年的仗。

sentences.english: She avoided having to work by battening on her rich relatives.
sentences.chinese: 她仗著她那些有钱的亲戚而不必工作，得以坐享清福。

sentences.english: O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is mine indignation.
sentences.chinese: 亚述是我怒气的棍，手中拿我恼恨的仗。

sentences.english: Comparison of its poetry Prosody pay attention to rhythm and tidy battle.
sentences.chinese: 其诗歌比较讲究韵律节奏和整齐仗。

sentences.english: England fought numerously for land in France and ended up winning and losing.
sentences.chinese: 英国为了争地，在法国打了很多仗，结果有赢有输。

sentences.english: But hey if they want a war, we'll give 'em war.
sentences.chinese: 但有谁想要打仗的话，我们也可以给他们个仗打打。

sentences.english: Abstract: Prequalification is the first key step that the construction enterprises strive for project implementation.
sentences.chinese: 资格预审是施工企业争取项目实施权的的“入门仗”。

sentences.english: It seemed as if the fight would never end.
If your battle wears falsely a voice, oneself looks for a bitterness to eat, that no wonder that we.
sentences.chinese: 要是你仗着虚声，自己寻苦吃，那就怪不得我们。

sentences.english: While we were slipping drilling line, they were measuring drill pipes.
sentences.chinese: 当我们滑大绳的时候，他们在仗量钻具。

definition: to fight a battle/to go to war
(coll.) to take a taxi/to go by taxi
to start a war/to open hostilities
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
